values: The Kanban Simulation Workshop targets anyone interested in learning what kanban is and why it works so well.

The seminar targets senior managers, typically with budget and resource allocation authority.

Our Kanban Foundation for Knowledge Work course targets anyone performing any type of knowledge work role. This would include, for example, anyone in operations, IT, finance, product management, HR, marketing, sales, etc.
Kanban for Service Management is designed for people who would like to use kanban to for the management of services. Typically, it targets process managers, team leaders and senior managers.
This course is for anyone performing any service management role and anyone else with an interest in managing services.

values: To organize a course, send an email describing your interest to training-admin\@3cs.ch.
To register for Kanban Foundation for Knowledge Work, go to the registration page.
The Kanban Simulation Workshop has no prerequisites. It assumes little or no knowledge of kanban.
The seminar target senior managers, typically with budget and resource allocation authority. It assumes no previous knowledge of kanban.

Kanban for Service Management assumes at least a basic knowledge of kanban, as provided by a course such as our Kanban Foundation or good practical experience. It also assumes a foundation-level knowledge of service management.

values: The Kanban Simulation and Kanban for Deciders seminars and our coaching and consulting are available face-to-face, in-house.
Kanban Foundation for Knowledge Work is an on-line, eLearning course. Kanban for Service Management will be available soon as an eLearning course.

Kanban for Deciders is three hour seminar providing senior managers with a hands-on understanding of what to expect from kanban and what kanban expects from management. You can find more details about this course by clicking here.
Kanban for Service Management builds on the kanban foundation to understand how to apply kanban to deliver and manage services. You can find more details about this course by clicking here.
Our Kanban Foundation is an on-line eLearning course providing all the methods and principles you need to start your kanban initiative. You can find more details about this course by clicking here.
Our Kanban Simulation is a two hour workshop introducing you to the basic principles of kanban in a gamified context. You can find more details about this course by clicking here.
You can find more details about this course by clicking here.
Kanban Foundation for Knowledge Work is an on-line, eLearning course. Kanban for Service Management will be available soon as an eLearning course.
The Kanban Simulation and Kanban for Deciders seminars and our coaching and consulting are available face-to-face, in-house.

values:
Kanban Foundation for Knowledge Work: eLearning with no fixed duration
ITIL Foundation: 3 days
Kanban for Deciders: 3 hours
Kanban for Service Management: two days
Kanban Simulation Workshop: 2-3 hours
Our Kanban for Service Management course lasts two days when delivered in-house. The on-line version (in preparation) has no fixed length.
The Kanban for Deciders seminar last one-half day, about 3 hours.

The on-line course Kanban Foundation for Knowledge Work has no fixed length. It consists of short video lessons, exercises, quizzes and an optional examination. The amount of time needed to complete the course depends on your availability.
The Kanban Simulation Workshop lasts two to three hours.
The ITIL Foundation course is 3 consecutive days, including the certification examination.

So the Irishman was on a trans-Atlantic flight, mid-way across, when the pilot made this announcement, "Ladies and gentlemen. We have had a little trouble with engine #4 and I have had to shut it down. We are perfectly safe, but will reach our destination 15 minutes behind schedule."
The Irishman was a little perturbed, but went back to his meal. A little while later, the pilot makes another announcement. "Ladies and gentlemen. I am sorry to say to we have now lost engine #2. The airplane is continuing to fly normally, but we will reach our destination one-half hour late."
The Irishman started to get nervous and beads of persperation appeared on his broad forehead.
Well, it wasn't long before the pilot made a third announcment. "Ladies and gentlemen. Now engine #3 has conked out. As you can see, we are continuing to fly on the single engine that is still operational. Unfortunately, we will reach our destination one hour late."
On hearing this, the Irishman couldn't stand the suspense any longer and he blurted out, "Begorrah! We better not lose that 4th engine or, for sure, we'll be up here all night!"

A mafioso needed to get a new accountant and decided to hire a deaf man, thinking that his secrets would be more secure that way. But after a while, the mafioso realized that the accountant was stealing money so he decided to confront him. He brought his consigliere with him, who knew sign language, to communicate with the deaf accountant.
“Ask him where my money is” told the mafioso to the consigliere. They exchanged signs with their hands and the boss asked, “What did he say?” The consigliere responded, “He said ‘Boss - I don't know what you're talking about.’” So the mafioso got flustered and said, “Tell him I mean business! He has to tell me where that money is!” And once again the consigliere signs the message and gets the accountant's response. “What did he say? What did he say?” asked the impatient chief. “He said,” replied the consigliere “that he really has no idea why you're asking this.”
Angry and frustrated, the mafioso pulled out a revolver and pointed it straight at the accountant's head. “Now. I give him one last chance. WHERE IS MY MONEY?” The consigliere once again passed on the message. The accountant was visibly shaken and beads of perspiration appeared on his forehead. After a minute's reflection he signed to the consigliere that the money was hidden in a bag that he buried behind his cousin's house. Crazy with impatience, the mafioso demanded to know the answer. And cool as a cucumber, the consigliere turned to the boss, replying, “He said, ‘you don't have the balls to shoot!’”
I really don't find that very funny.

So a man with a broad smile on his face entered one of those trains with compartments and found one where there was only one other passenger. Sitting down, he said to the man, “I just heard a great Fredonia joke. Let me tell it to you.”
The other passenger replied, “You can't tell me a Fredonia joke.”
“Why not? It's really funny. You'll like it. You see...”
“Stop right there! No Fredonia jokes!”
“I don't understand. Don't you like jokes?”
“You can't tell me a Fredonia joke because I'm Fredonian!”
The man was taken aback at first, but then said. “That's alright. That's OK...I'll tell it to you twice!”

Thank you for your concern about our security. With the exception of your personal data, there is nothing confidential at this site. We protect the integrity of the information displayed using encrypted communications and start of the art protection of the web server, provided by our hosting service.

Thank you for your remark about our handling of your personal data. We operate in compliance with the EU GDPR. For more information, please view our <a href="https://www.3cs.ch/personal-data-faq/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Personal Data FAQ</a.

Thank you for your remark about our handling of your credit card information. We do not store your credit card information anywhere. It is transmitted directly to the payment gateway you choose when making a payment. All communications are encrypted using https.

values: I am Sophos, an automated agent with natural language processing. How am I doing?
We offer the ITIL Foundation course, in English or in French. You can find more details by clicking here

We have 4 kanban courses:
  • Kanban Foundation for Knowledge Work
  • Kanban for Deciders
  • Kanban Simulation
  • Kanban for Service Managers
Let me ask you a few suggestions to find a good course for you. Is that OK with you?

Our Kanban Foundation for Knowledge Work teaches all the concepts required to improve the use of kanban on a daily basis. After you get some more experience using kanban try our Kanban for Service Management course.
If you already have good experience with kanban, perhaps you would be interesting in our coaching service to help make additional improvements in a lightweight but effective way.
To get a good idea of what you can expect when your provider uses kanban, we suggest organizing the Kanban Simulation seminar.
Our Kanban Foundation for Knowledge Work teaches all the concepts required to use kanban and to improve on a daily basis.

You can start with the Kanban Simulation seminar and follow that up with the Kanban Foundation for Knowledge Work. After you get some experience using kanban try our Kanban for Service Management course.

You can start with the Kanban Simulation seminar and follow that up with the Kanban Foundation for Knowledge Work. After you get some experience using kanban try our Kanban for Service Management course.
Our course Kanban for Service Managers explains how to use kanban to manage services. It assumes a foundation knowledge of kanban.

We have a seminar, Kanban for Deciders, specially designed for the management team to help them understand what to expect from kanban and what kanban expects from managers. In parallel, your practitioners should take our Kanban Foundation for Knowledge Work course

We have an advanced course, Kanban for Service Managers, but suggest that you start with our Kanban Foundation for Knowledge Work. It teaches all the concepts required to improve the use of kanban on a daily basis.
You can start with the Kanban Simulation seminar and follow that up with the Kanban Foundation for Knowledge Work.

ITIL is a framework of practices for managing IT services. It defines a service life-cycle, a process architecture and provides advice on organizational structure, tools and other aspects of service management.

values: I cannot help you unless you tell me what you what to know

Perhaps you could look around our web site. If you have any questions, come back here.

Kanban is a method for managing the flow of work. It uses physical or virtual cards (kanban cards) to visualize and control the flow of work. Our course Kanban Foundation for Knowledge Work gives a complete overview of the principles and methods used by kanban to optimize the flow of work.
Basically, I am here to help you find which of our services and training would be the most useful for you.
